## MEP.decodeChromosome() method

Decodes given chromosome into an array of [ASTNode](./gp.astnode.md)<!-- -->s and optionally applies tree depth filter (by default includes all).

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
decodeChromosome(chromosome: MEPChromosome<OP, T>, minDepth?: number, maxDepth?: number): ASTNode<OP, T>[];
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  chromosome | <code>MEPChromosome&lt;OP, T&gt;</code> |  |
|  minDepth | <code>number</code> |  |
|  maxDepth | <code>number</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`ASTNode<OP, T>[]`

## Remarks

A [MEPChromosome](./gp.mepchromosome.md) encodes multiple solutions (one per gene slot), therefore a chromosome of length `n` will produce the same number ASTs (less if min/max tree depth filters are applied).
